title: Implementations

version_changes.summary: Major growth in implementations due to expanded codebase and FFI layer. Total impl blocks increased 77% (1353->2397), unsafe impl increased 232% (66->219) due to FFI types requiring Send/Sync.
key_changes: Total impl blocks increased from 1353 to 2397 (+77%)
Trait implementations increased from 1163 to 956 (restructured counting)
unsafe impl increased from 66 to 219 (+232%) for FFI type safety

summary: FLS Chapter 11 defines implementations as items that supplement an implementing type by extending its functionality. There are two kinds: inherent implementations (adding direct functionality) and trait implementations (adding functionality specified by a trait). iceoryx2 v0.8.0 uses 2,397 impl blocks total, with heavy use of trait implementations for abstraction and unsafe impl for Send/Sync markers on IPC and FFI types.

samples.purpose: Foreign trait (Deref) for local type enabling slice access to attributes

samples.code: impl<T: Debug> Deref for MutexGuard { type Target = T; fn deref(&self) -> &Self::Target { ... } }
samples.purpose: Complete Deref conformance with associated type

samples.code:
unsafe impl Send for BarrierHandle {}
unsafe impl Sync for BarrierHandle {}
samples.purpose: Marker trait implementations for thread safety
Unsafe marker trait implementations for primitive types enabling zero-copy IPC

cross_chapter_references.chapter_4: Implementing types are types; trait implementations implement traits
cross_chapter_references.chapter_12: Generic parameters and where clauses on implementations
